comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content:
The picture at top is Jetty No. 1 Circular Quay which on a 1906 Sydney Harbour Trust map is also noted as the Phillip Landing Stage, probably because it was at the end of Phillip Street. 
It perhaps suggests that Captain Arthur Phillip landed here but he didn't. There is a plaque/flagpole outside the western entrance door to Customs House which celebrates the Bicentenial of Captain Arthur Phillip's landing at that spot (my map comparisons put his actual landing spot in the middle of Loftus Street). The north western corner of Customs House sits over the original shoreline. As the birthplace of a nation, worth a dig in my opinion.
